medical_history.chief_complaint: Hemiparesis, aphasia, and abnormalities on neuroimaging studies.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 years ago with right-sided weakness, clumsiness, and slurred speech that developed over 24 hours. The patient was previously well except for migraine headaches. Symptoms worsened over the next 4 days, with the addition of dysphagia. After receiving intravenous methylprednisolone, the dysphagia gradually improved, but right arm paretic and increased tone persisted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic migraine headaches since mid-20s, with episodes occurring four to five times per year, lasting 4 to 6 hours.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of migraine headaches in parents, siblings, and nephews; two brothers diagnosed with multiple sclerosis; mother had a transient ischemic attack; one brother exhibited cognitive and word-finding problems, and another had arm spasms and difficulty speaking.
medical_history.social_history: Former smoker and alcohol user, ceased both 15 years prior. Work history as a carpenter until disability due to illness.
